title: Make "author list" look good in large events

milestone.title: v2.0
milestone.description:
This version will provide:

* a complete new DB backend (RDBMS)
* a more modular Indico
* a brand-new namespace

body:
The Author list (List of Contributions) currently looks pretty awful when:
- There are many authors (large events)
- The affiliations/names are too long (add ellipsis?)

![screen shot 2016-07-18 at 10 54 02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2699/16909946/e6c036f4-4cd5-11e6-8d27-2e1989796e27.png)

title: In 3-step booking, choice of days is not limited
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

When using the 3-step booking process, one can successfully pick any future day for a reservation, regardless of the "maximum days in advance" setting.
The result is a (super ugly) error message containing an error report.

One solution would be to show the "bars" of rooms that are not "bookable" for a specific day already in red (or another explanatory color) in the availability view (with an informative tooltip).

title: Sort abstract authors by last name
body: I am yet to see someone who thinks that sorting them by first name makes any sense. So, this should be fixed ASAP.

title: Fix outdatedbrowser warning on Edge for iOS

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
This UA string should not trigger the warning, since `ios_saf 12.2` is currently the required iOS version. Looks like we aren't overriding `browserName` to pretend everything is Safari on iOS...

```
Mozilla/5.0 (iPad; CPU OS 12_4 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/12.0 EdgiOS/44.6.1 Mobile/15E148 Safari/605.1.15
```

title: Save button not enabled when adding a room in a location

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the room booking system, add a room in a location.  In the "Add Room" dialog there are some fields marked with red asterisk which is required.  However the save button would not be enabled even all the fields were filled.  I also *need to* fill both "Longitude" and "Latitude" then the save button will be enabled, and will keep enabled even I remove the value in Longitude and Latitude.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Room booking system
2. Click on 'Administration'
3. Click on a pre-defined location and click "Add room"
4. In the "Add Room" dialog the save button is disabled until I fill both Longitude and Latitude


**Expected behavior**
I should be able to save the room without filling the Longitude and Latitude

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/179599/67635434-8f6d5c00-f8c7-11e9-9eec-84e52ada30c6.png)

title: Failed login message: Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen: [error]
body:
Using Indico 3.2.2, if providing incorrect credentials, and trying to log in using LDAP, the error is:

    Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen: [error]

In the log it says:

    2022-08-25 09:36:35,370  WARNING  37654e7b0fa34280  -       indico.auth               Invalid credentials (ip=X, provider=ldap): No such user

or

    2022-08-25 09:32:35,228  WARNING  4aeb1fe5702a46ef  -       indico.auth               Invalid credentials (ip=X, provider=ldap): Invalid credentials

Could that string be used instead? (No idea, if it should be generalized to not allow somebody to check for valid user names.)

title: Don't lose all input after a HTML security error in PR assessment comments
body:
When commenting on a Paper (Paper Reviewing => Assess content) using disallowed HTML tags in the comment results in a HTML security error. This is the correct behavior, but it currently clears the textarea, so the whole comment is lost even though it would be easy for the user to fix the actual issue.
- [x] Preserve the entered text in case of an error so the user can correct it.
- [ ] If we do not render the comments as HTML anywhere, we could disable the HTML security check for them - it doesn't make much sense to do this for plaintext data.

title: Modifying an entry causes it to get duplicated
body:
To reproduce:
- Add a news entry
- Edit title
- Refresh page

title: Client-side validation for time input field (Safari)
body:
The time input field [doesn't work well on Safari](http://caniuse.com/#feat=input-pattern), since it allows free text and it's not restricted to a pair of digits.
This creates problems as people may enter whatever they want, leading to error reports.
We need to check if there is an easy way to implement a client-side validation for the time input field [1]. Server-side validation would lead to loss of data when the form is submitted.

[1]: Maybe `patternMismatch` can help: http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/forms/constraintvalidation/

title: JS error on login page
body:
On the login page there's a JS error, which prevents switching between local login methods for example.

`ReferenceError: $ is not defined`

Maybe something wrong with the webpack bundles there?

title: Registration form: "no accommodation" and "mandatory" shouldn't be exclusive
body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2699/22504313/033674ce-e876-11e6-8414-619914365989.png)

Right now, if we make "accommodation" mandatory, we disable the "no accommodation" option. That shouldn't happen, as the organizer should be able to require an accommodation option even if that is "no accommodation". The two options should be independent.

title: Reservations in the future can't be modified to an earlier date
body:
When trying to modify a reservation, users can't select a day prior to the day the reservation was initially created for because the days in the calendar appear grayed out.

This is what happens:

```
Today |----------- invalid dates -----------| Reservation |------------ valid dates
19 Jan                                          12 Feb
```

This is what should happen:

```
Today |------------ valid dates ------------| Reservation |------------ valid dates
19 Jan                                          12 Feb
```

title: Conferences: contribution attachment list not refreshed after upload/change
body: That seems to affect all conference events. It's pretty easy to reproduce.

title: Unexpected behavior when editing session in event page
body:
Using the edit (pencil) button next to a session in the timetable area of an event page, does not prompt to edit the correct session.
Example:
Trying to edit the basic info of "Talk from organizers" will end up editing the session right bellow (meeting new members)
![](http://i.imgur.com/7GWPPrM.png)

Another example:
Editing the 1st session, will give an error, whereas editing the 3rd session will prompt to edit the 1st one:
![](http://i.imgur.com/wPCifVE.png)

title: Translation error in German roombooking error message when trying to book an already booked timeslot
body:
**Describe the bug**
See issue title, not much else to say about it.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Select a room (e.g. from the bookings overview)
2. Start a booking and select a timeslot which is already booked
3. An error message is displayed: "Raum kann nicht reserviert werden. Der Raum ist in dem/den ausgewählten Zeitfenster(n) frei"

**Expected behavior**
The second sentence of the translation seems to be missing a "nicht" or other negation to indicate that the room is in fact not free to book at the selected timeslot.
(The English error message is: "Space cannot be booked. One or more bookings would conflict with yours.")

title: JS error ($.mathjax not defined) on conference pages
body:
Go to any conference page and check the JS error console:

> TypeError: $(...).mathJax is not a function

Probably the `mathjax_js` bundle is not included on conference pages. Also text that mathjax is properly rendered in conference titles after fixing this (put e.g. `$\Phi$` in a conference title).

title: Access rights mismatch - people with rights for "Registrations" see Payments tab, but get Access denied
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have a conference with Manual and Bank transfer payment modules enabled.
A person has been granted Access and Registration rights using the Protection/Event protection tabs.
Now, she can enter the Management area and sees two tabs - Payments and Registrations.
But clicking on the Payments tab yields "You are not authorised to manage this event.".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a conference
2. Enable payments, manual payment and Bank transfer module
3. Make a registration form that results in money to be wired
3. Add a person from accounting department with rights for Registration and explain her that she will handle registration payments.
4. Let the user login and go to the management area.
5. Let the user click Payments
6. Run, Forest, run! Because the "You are not authorised" error will be displayed and the person will get confused.

**Expected behavior**
The payments tab should not be visible if the person has no right to access it.

title: Make list of e-mails in e-mail dialogs less awful
body: When we're mailing many people, the whole thing becomes giant.

title: Trim criteria in user search dialog
body: We are not trimming leading nor trailing whitespace and search doesn't find the users in those cases.

title: Relative dates in "News" section on start page broken in German translation
body:
**Describe the bug**
A picture says more than 1000 words:
![Indico_German_Date](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/166759/b4f7dfb3-561c-4538-80bf-576a52173af1)

It seems the relative date is formatted wrongly, i.e. it reads:
` Veröffentlicht am “53tMESZt3r” Mittwoch `
instead of:
` Veröffentlicht am letzten Mittwoch `

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add a news message for which a relative date will be used, e.g. within the last week. 
2. Use timezone `Europe/Berlin`. 
3. Visit Indico start page and select German language. 

**Additional Information**
Using a different timezone, e.g. UTC, yields:
` Veröffentlicht am “53tUTCt3r” Mittwoch `

Switching to English shows:
` Posted Last Wednesday `
as expected.

Since turning off menu customization means that all custom pages will be deleted, we normally display a confirmation pop-up before a user is allowed to do it. For some reason, the pop-up is not working anymore.

title: Backspace key closes minutes editor

milestone.title: v1.9
milestone.description:
Internal release that will include:

* Room Booking Module migrated to new RDBMS.
* New Whoosh Indexer for Category and Event names.

body:
Previously reported by @lnielsen-cern, but now able to reproduce.

(Using Chrome 38 on OSX)
1. Open the minutes editor
2. Add a bullet point
3. Press `TAB`. The editor won't catch the keypress and the browser will move the focus to the `Save` button
4. Press `backspace`
5. The browser will go back to the previous page

title: Missing "Description" in survey results
body:
We currently show only the question and the chart of the answers, which in some situations doesn't provide enough context. E.g.:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/40773443-2fc041f8-64c3-11e8-92ed-823671592870.png)

(legend missing)

title: Validation for price missing in social event dialog
body: While editing the registration form a social event can be configured as billable and empty string as price. This causes an exception on form submission that prevents users from registering. We should add validation in the client-side and also default to 0 in any case when received.

title: Invalid URL when booking a room for a multi-days event

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**

When trying to book a room for multi-days event ('Book' on the Event in Room Booking in Event management), the URL created is for a daily booking from the first day to the last day of the meeting, from the time of the start of the meeting to the time of the end of the meeting.
This work well if the meeting starts and ends every day at the same time, but for a meeting which starts one day after lunch and ends on a following day before lunch the time selected has it's end before its start...

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an event starting on day X at 13:30 and ending at day X+n at 12:30
2. Click on 'Room Booking'
3. Click 'Book'
4. See error: `Something went wrong The provided URL was not properly formatted.`

**Expected behavior**
Well, the correct behavior is difficult to define, as the timeslots of the room booking for daily booking don't really match the event boundaries. At least I'm expecting not to get an error.
A solution could be to give the option to give links to book days independently if they don't start/end at the same time?
